title: How the status symbol range cooker is getting a high-tech upgrade
text:
The Aga, that workhorse of the country kitchen, has amassed a cult-like status and a roster of celebrity fans since it was invented by a Swede in 1922.

In recent years the fashion for this kind of huge range cooker has spread from its rural roots to a more urban, cool outlook, with brands such as Rangemaster, Smeg and Wolf becoming popular. But with the advent of minimalist smart ovens that are voice-controlled by Alexa (and our increasing collective carbon-footprint guilt), are we still in love with ranges, those SUVs of the cooking world?

The developer Ballymore is banking on apartment buyers warming to a range. In what it believes to be a first, it is installing Italian electric Bertazzoni...
description: The Aga, that workhorse of the country kitchen, has amassed a cult-like status and a roster of celebrity fans since it was invented by a Swede in 1922.
